title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:03 <mflorea> has quit  
00:42 <rrodriguez> has quit  
04:16 <sdumitriu> has quit  
04:16 <abusenius> has quit  
04:33 <DrLou> has quit

05:17 <venkatesh> has quit  
06:02 <Denis> has quit  
06:05 <BLOBO> has joined #xwiki  
06:09 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
07:06 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:18 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
07:52 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:32 <sburjan``> has joined #xwiki  
08:32 <sburjan``> has left #xwiki  
08:39 <jstoldt> has joined #xwiki  
08:39 <jstoldt> good morning!  
09:10 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:10 <mflorea> has quit  
09:15 <rrodriguez> has quit  
09:28 <jstoldt> cjdelisle: guess what, tomcat crashed again after using up all the memory...  
09:29 <jstoldt> upgrading to tomcat 7.0.6  
09:45 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
09:46 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
09:46 <SvenDowideit\_> has joined #xwiki  
09:55 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:14 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:14 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:27 <vmassol> morning everyone  
10:27 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
10:27 <vmassol> hmm just got a build failure on the lucene plugin: http://pastebin.com/53yURAkU  
10:28 <vmassol> seems it's an intermittent error  
10:35 <+mflorea> yes, I could build it locally  
10:36 <vmassol> I tried a second time and it worked  
10:36 <vmassol> probably some race condition that we'd need to fix  
10:36 <vmassol> since lucene plugin is using multiple threads  
10:37 <vmassol> guys how are we doing for the release (we're 4 days late as of now)  
10:38 <vmassol> that looks too good to be true: http://hudson.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-product-enterprise-tests/305/testReport/  
10:38 <vmassol> is it? :)  
10:40 <+mflorea> it's true, I'm fixing the ui test and the escaping was fixed by sergiu, should pass after the next tests run  
10:41 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:41 <vmassol> nice so we can start the release real soon. I think you could send a mail on the list to mention to hold commits since you're starting it, wdyt?  
10:43 <+mflorea> yep  
10:44 <vmassol> on my side I'm rebuilding now to test the latest commits done by sergiu with vertical menus  
10:44 <+mflorea> ok  
10:48 <Denis> has quit  
10:56 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
11:04 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
11:08 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
11:08 <jvelo> has quit  
11:11 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
11:16 <vmassol> sdumitriu: Hi. I'm trying to test the new admin UI with vertical menus but I don't see anything  
11:17 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: It's not committed that part  
11:17 <vmassol> ah ok… is there anything visual at this point? so it'll be in M2?  
11:20 <vmassol> sdumitriu: fyi I'm testing pivotaltracker for fun. Just sent you an invitation  
11:32 <@sdumitriu> Looks a lot like what I had in mind  
11:32 <vmassol> sdumitriu: it has jira integration too apparently (reading on it)  
11:32 <vmassol> https://www.pivotaltracker.com/help/integrations#jira  
11:48 <+sburjan> sdumitriu, vmassol : you have my OK for the release. I have updated the MTR  
11:48 <vmassol> good  
11:48 <vmassol> thanks  
11:48 <vmassol> it's mflorea actually who's the release manager  
11:49 <+sburjan> I know.  
11:50 <+sburjan> we fixed the last failing test, waiting for Hudson to re-run and see if we are on the Green  
11:55 <vmassol> guys can we fix myxwiki.org and remove the issue with the top level menus?  
11:55 <vmassol> what needs to be done?  
11:55 <vmassol> I remember sdumitriu said it was a user who had done some customization in his wiki. Is there a way to find this wiki and remove the custo?  
11:55 <@sdumitriu> Fix macro namespacing  
11:56 <vmassol> sdumitriu: I mean something we can do now  
11:56 <vmassol> quickly before we do the right fix  
11:56 <vmassol> right now it's not sending a good impression to myxwiki users  
11:56 <@sdumitriu> http://slussen.myxwiki.org/  
11:56 <@sdumitriu> The wiki looks used, I doubt we can just break it  
11:57 <vmassol> wow  
11:57 <@sdumitriu> But you can contact the owner and tell him that his skin is breaking all the other wikis  
11:57 <@sdumitriu> And if he would be so kind to use the standard skin, or rename his macros, until we fix the problem  
11:58 <vmassol> sdumitriu: you think you could explain that in an email to him? I can send it if you want but I'd need to technical explanation of what he needs to do  
12:00 <vmassol> mflorea: someone is asking if our wysiwyg editor works on the ipad  
12:01 <vmassol> I just tried it quickly and it seems we don't see the cursor and when I click on a word for ex, the virtual keyboard doesn't appear  
12:01 <vmassol> nothing urgent nor critical but I thought maybe you knew what's the issue  
12:01 <vmassol> (btw would be good for buzz if it were working although it's probbaly not a priority for us)  
12:01 <+mflorea> I'll try it out (Mihai has an ipad, I can ask him to test)  
12:03 <vmassol> k  
12:05 <+sburjan> vmassol: also an important issue, we had an user on userList complaining he's not able to login to Safari ..  
12:06 <vmassol> yep need someone to look at this. works on ipad though ;)  
12:06 <vmassol> lunch time here  
12:19 <+sburjan> here too  
12:19 <+sburjan> btw, 0 failures :)  
12:20 <+sburjan> nop, still running  
12:33 <jvelo> any feedback on my mail re- PR right metadata ?  
12:33 <jvelo> I could work on it this afternoon  
12:51 <vmassol> jvelo: IMO it's a topic that requires a bit of thoughts. I'm replying now  
13:10 <vmassol> jvelo: replied with some questions  
13:10 <vmassol> not bad: http://hudson.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-product-enterprise-tests/lastBuild/testReport/ :)  
13:13 <@sdumitriu> And the failing test looks like a flicker  
13:17 <vmassol> sdumitriu: I have found the mail of the slussen admin guy. Can you tell me what I should ask him precisely to do?  
13:27 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: yes, it looks like a flicker. Who stopped the Hudson build and started it again ?  
13:27 <+sburjan> or am I reading the data wrong ?  
13:32 <@sdumitriu> It wasn't me  
13:32 <@sdumitriu> Are you sure it was stopped?  
13:33 <+sburjan> how do you interpret this ? http://hudson.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-product-enterprise-tests/308/  
13:34 <vmassol> a bug in hudson?  
13:34 <vmassol> they were executed  
13:34 <vmassol> they're duplicate in the list of modules  
13:35 <+sburjan> oh.. you're right.. so I interpreted in thewrong way  
13:43 <vmassol> myxwiki dead….. hope it's restarting  
13:49 <vmassol> ok back  
14:05 <fmancinelli> has quit  
14:06 <rrodriguez\_> has joined #xwiki  
14:06 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
14:07 <rrodriguez\_> has quit  
14:09 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: what's the status of XWIKI-913 ?  
14:09 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
14:10 <@sdumitriu> Not done yet  
14:11 <@sdumitriu> It can be moved to M2  
14:12 <+mflorea> ok  
14:14 <+mflorea> vmassol: what's the status of XWIKI-5807 ?  
14:15 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: what about XWIKI-5750 ? You committed against it but it doesn't have an assignee :)  
14:15 <vmassol> mflorea: let me split it in 2 and close it  
14:15 <+mflorea> great, thanks vmassol  
14:16 <@sdumitriu> I'll close XWIKI-5750  
14:17 <+mflorea> great, thanks sdumitriu  
14:19 <vmassol> mflorea: done thanks  
14:23 <vmassol> mflorea: so opera browser is supported now?  
14:23 <vmassol> is it in the list of supported browsers on xwiki.org?  
14:24 <vmassol> (I see you close the issue entitled "add support for opera")  
14:24 <+mflorea> vmassol: basic features are. I close that issue mainly because new issues should be opened separately  
14:24 <vmassol> then maybe we should add a more descriptive title  
14:24 <vmassol> but still the question is: do we consider we support it now?  
14:24 <vmassol> ie add it in the list supported browsers on xwiki.org  
14:25 <+mflorea> yes, we can, and we should expect users to report features that don't work  
14:25 <+sburjan> hope I won't have to test on opera too :)  
14:25 <vmassol> same for chrome/safari?  
14:25 <+mflorea> yes  
14:26 <+sburjan> Safari login doesn't work properly ATM  
14:26 <+mflorea> IMO we should add all three, and ask users to report bugs  
14:26 <+mflorea> sburjan: supported doesn't mean there are no bugs at all  
14:26 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: Does the login always fail? I saw that someone said it works when clicking "remember me"  
14:26 <vmassol> mflorea: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Installation#HPrerequisites  
14:27 <+evalica> sdumitriu: it works when you press remember  
14:27 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: yes, it works only if you click "Remember Me"  
14:27 <+sburjan> :))  
14:27 <@sdumitriu> Well, don't people want to be remembered?  
14:27 <@sdumitriu> :)  
14:28 <+evalica> yes they do .... and not be called "someone"  :P  
14:28 <+mflorea> vmassol: I'll update that  
14:28 <vmassol> k  
14:28 <vmassol> I think you also have that info in the some wysiwyg editor doc, no?  
14:28 <vmassol> (maybe best is to centralize the info)  
14:29 <mbryant> has joined #xwiki  
14:29 <+mflorea> yes, I'll include Features.WysiwygEditorPrerequisites there too  
14:33 <mbryant> would there be any chance of XWQL being used inside objects for DBLIST and DBTREE anytime soon? and a follow up to that would be, how hard would it be (not having looked at the source yet) to extend the QueryManaer to do a different language as well  
14:34 <vmassol> mbryant: there's a jira issue for this AFAIR. Someone needs to contribute a patch for it though  
14:34 <vmassol> it's not hard to do AFAIK  
14:35 <vmassol> the hard part for a new language is the parser and execution engine  
14:35 <vmassol> otherwse from an API POV it's easy to provide a new impl  
14:36 <mbryant> vmassol: The reason that I asked the second question was because, locally, for what we are using xwiki for, we are attempting to back end it into a Triplestore, so it would be nice to be able to do SPARQL quries to the TripleStore  
14:36 <vmassol> just need to implement QueryExecutor  
14:37 <mbryant> alright thanks.  
14:38 <vmassol> mbryant: http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-2870 for ex  
14:39 <mbryant> from a user standpoint, it would be a nice thing to have...  
14:39 <vmassol> yes  
14:40 <mbryant> just fyi, I know the current roadmap is not headed that way but... it might play into the app under a minute task  
14:40 <vmassol> mbryant: we also need internally to stop using hql and instead use xwql  
14:40 <vmassol> right now we use hql almost everywhere in our code  
14:40 <vmassol> mbryant: so you're using xwql right now?  
14:41 <mbryant> yea... in documents/pages  
14:41 <vmassol> cool, works fine?  
14:42 <mbryant> yep, the only thing that I have had to use HQL for is searching for a specific tag from the tag class  
14:42 <mbryant> so looking for a sepecific value contained in a DBList  
14:42 <mbryant> perhaps I should JIRA that  
14:42 <vmassol> hmm I don't know xwql enough to answer that. It's not in the examples on the query guide?  
14:43 <rrodriguez\_> has joined #xwiki  
14:43 <+mflorea> vmassol: do you what is tmortagne's status on XWIKI-5557 and XWIKI4237 ?  
14:43 <mbryant> i can get all the instances of a class... myself and cjdelisle could not get XWQL to do it  
14:43 <+mflorea> XWIKI-4237  
14:43 <vmassol> mbryant: yep you should jira it then  
14:43 <vmassol> mflorea: not done yet  
14:43 <vmassol> he committed a bit on it but it's not done  
14:44 <vmassol> for both  
14:44 <rrodriguez> has quit  
14:44 <rrodriguez\_> is now known as <rrodriguez>  
14:44 <vmassol> should be pushed for 3.0M2  
14:44 <+mflorea> ok, good  
14:45 <+mflorea> jvelo: what's the status of XWIKI-5194?  
14:49 <mbryant> has quit  
14:49 <vmassol> sdumitriu: I rebuilt trunk earlier today (after your commits) and the AS is empty (it has only 2 entries created 2 hours ago about watchlist notifier class)  
14:49 <vmassol> is that normal?  
14:50 <@sdumitriu> Change some documents  
14:50 <@sdumitriu> Do events appear after that?  
14:50 <vmassol> yes  
14:50 <vmassol> the question is whether it's normal that it's empty initially  
14:50 <vmassol> you fixed that?  
14:50 <@sdumitriu> I fixed the fact that it was always empty  
14:51 <@sdumitriu> And I think it's normal to be empty initially  
14:51 <vmassol> I know we wanted an empty AS but I didn't know we had implemeted it  
14:51 <@sdumitriu> Did you buid jetty-hsqldb?  
14:51 <vmassol> maybe it's because I changed the package plugin dep on core  
14:52 <vmassol> I built the whole platform and Xe  
14:52 <vmassol> it's still strange since the packager imports the default XAR  
14:52 <vmassol> and thus should generate AS events  
14:52 <vmassol> but maybe there's a side effects that prevents this from happening  
14:53 <vmassol> I don't recall anyone doing this voluntarily  
14:53 <vmassol> hence my question  
14:53 <@sdumitriu> FYI, I downgraded myxwiki to Java 1.5  
15:08 <+sburjan> :)  
15:32 <vmassol> mflorea: you need a XEM  column too for the translations in the release plan  
15:34 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: No, I removed that one  
15:34 <vmassol> sdumitriu: why?  
15:34 <@sdumitriu> XEM is not released in milestones  
15:35 <@sdumitriu> He can commit translations now, but they won't be released  
15:35 <vmassol> ah yes ok...  
15:48 <vmassol> "If you're using the hudsonagent machine to perform the release". I don't think we've documented what this means  
15:49 <vmassol> it's like adding "in case you've eaten some burritos during the release make sure you go to the toilet at the end of the release", no?  
15:49 <vmassol> :)  
15:49 <vmassol> (if you see what I mean)  
15:52 <@sdumitriu> Documenting now  
15:53 <jstoldt> seems like you got a pretty solid schedule after eating burritos... just saying ;)  
15:53 <vmassol> hehe  
15:55 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: quick question. If a 2.7 XEM has a blank Activity Stream, how can that be fixed ? I've see the solution on the mailing list, but I can't find the e-mail  
15:55 <@sdumitriu> Save the Main.Activity document with programming rights?  
15:55 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Better?  
15:56 <vmassol> hmmm I'd do only the perform there  
15:57 <vmassol> thus I'd move this info box in the perform step  
15:57 <@sdumitriu> WDYM only the perform?  
15:57 <@sdumitriu> Feel free to move it where you think it's better  
15:59 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: That's wron  
15:59 <@sdumitriu> You can't perform if you don't prepare on the same machine  
15:59 <vmassol> that's what I'm doing  
15:59 <vmassol> works very well  
15:59 <@sdumitriu> Really?  
15:59 <vmassol> you just need to pass the tag  
16:00 <@sdumitriu> Ah, right, that way it works  
16:00 <vmassol> see http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-release-plugin/examples/perform-release.html  
16:00 <vmassol> ok I'll move the info box a bit higher  
16:01 <@sdumitriu> But I don't see the benefit of separating prepare and perform  
16:01 <@sdumitriu> It's always faster on the other end  
16:01 <vmassol> I think I had a reason but I don't remember it right now  
16:02 <vmassol> you're doing the branches there too?  
16:02 <@sdumitriu> Depends  
16:02 <@sdumitriu> I for one yes  
16:02 <vmassol> ok I've reverted to your version  
16:02 <@sdumitriu> But not all the times  
16:07 <abusenius> has quit  
16:13 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
16:28 <@sdumitriu> Performance Improvement ideas:  
16:28 <@sdumitriu> http://173-203-64-171.static.cloud-ips.com/ZoompfFree/scans/240d8d995b53f131ef8b5c1fd675bb0e/report.html  
16:28 <@sdumitriu> http://validator.w3.org/mobile/check?task=2011011219433847.mobile1&docAddr=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.xwiki.org%2Fxwiki%2Fbin%2Fview%2FMain%2FWebHome  
16:30 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: IRC Bot is included in Platform ? Because I see that Marius has it listed in XWiki Platform when he issued some command  
16:30 <@sdumitriu> No  
16:30 <@sdumitriu> Wait  
16:30 <@sdumitriu> It is in the platform, meaning that it's source code is in platform/applications  
16:31 <@sdumitriu> But it isn't bundled in XE  
16:31 <+sburjan> so basically IRC Bot comes with platform, butthe "interface" like pages are not bundled with XE ?  
16:32 <@sdumitriu> It doesn't come  
16:32 <@sdumitriu> There are a lot of plugins and applications in the svn that aren't part of the XE distribution  
16:33 <@sdumitriu> Look at https://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/xwiki-applications/trunk/  
16:34 <@sdumitriu> calendar, ircbot, photoalbum, s5, selenium, workstream are not in XE  
16:34 <+sburjan> by XE you mean Platform + Enterprise bunde, or only XE as the small XAR that contains pages ?  
16:35 <+sburjan> it's a little ambiguity  
16:35 <cjdelisle> vmassol: I'm replying to your email, there's something I need to know. Are you -1 to using anything other than JPA for transaction control?  
16:36 <@sdumitriu> Any of them  
16:37 <+sburjan> because when I hear platform i think of https://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/ .. and in my mind everything from here gets build and is the Platform, in which you import XE.XAR  
16:38 <@sdumitriu> Platform means two things  
16:38 <@sdumitriu> The important one is the enterprise-war  
16:38 <@sdumitriu> Or the platform-web-standard war  
16:38 <@sdumitriu> Neither of them includes any application  
16:38 <+sburjan> I see  
16:39 <@sdumitriu> Not ircbot, not administration, so it doesn't matter whats in https://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/xwiki-applications/trunk/  
16:40 <+sburjan> because I never understood exactly  
16:40 <@sdumitriu> Applications are in enterpise-wiki, which ends up in enterprise-jetty-hsqldb  
16:40 <@sdumitriu> And that's XE  
16:40 <+sburjan> yes  
16:40 <@sdumitriu> Which chooses what applications it wants to bundle  
16:40 <@sdumitriu> And it doesn't have to pick up all that's in https://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/xwiki-applications/trunk/  
16:40 <+sburjan> I see  
16:40 <@sdumitriu> So ircbot is hosted in the main SVN repository, inside the platform  
16:40 <@sdumitriu> But it's not used anywhere  
16:41 <@sdumitriu> It's a custom application that can be built and used by whoever wants it  
16:41 <+sburjan> yes...  
16:42 <+sburjan> but I know that XE can be built manuall if you want, by downloading the platform zip + importing the xe.xar. But I don't understand where can I find the platform .. meaning the blank XWiki, the XWiki which doesn't have XE in it  
16:43 <+jvdrean> mflorea: may maven be with you  
16:44 <+sburjan> :)  
16:44 <+mflorea> jvdrean: Amen!  
16:44 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Where did you put the xwiki:livetable:ready event?  
16:44 <sburjan> has quit  
16:55 <vmassol> cjdelisle: no I'm not ?1 (there was no vote btw). I'm just asking question to make sure we have covered all various angles and that we don't hit a blocker later on  
16:55 <vmassol> sdumitriu: it's in livetable.js isn't it?  
16:56 <@sdumitriu> I can't find it  
16:56 <cjdelisle> I see. There are some things I know not to get in the way of AKA: the JCR express.  
16:57 <vmassol> sdumitriu: cheecking functional tests  
16:57 <vmassol> it's displayComplete  
16:57 <vmassol>  executeJavascript("document.observe('xwiki:livetable:" + this.livetableId + ":displayComplete', function() {"  
16:58 <@sdumitriu> OK, so the documentation is wrong?  
16:58 <vmassol> what doc?  
17:02 <cjdelisle> Send a reply detaling the requirements which TR was designed for (I should have written that in the original mail). I think those requirements can be used to evaluate JTA.  
17:04 <cjdelisle> I find that the Java Community Process has a lot of trouble with committee issues (Parkinson's laws). The code gets too big because everyone has an edge use case which they absolutely need an explicit function for that case.  
17:19 <xiuu> has joined #xwiki  
17:19 <xiuu> has left #xwiki  
17:20 <evalica> has quit  
17:22 <Enygma`> has quit  
17:29 <cjdelisle> Denis: I am planning on changing PTR so that PTR extends TR<R> and removing asRequirer() because it is redundant.  
17:29 <cjdelisle> This is because I can't think of any other solution.  
17:31 <cjdelisle> Did you say the abstract solution wasn't passing all of the tests?  
17:36 <cjdelisle> give people a way to write non-java in a .java file. They abuse it with a vengence.  
17:36 <vmassol> it is java  
17:37 <cjdelisle> It kind of extends java.  
17:37 <vmassol> AFAIK it's part of the java language spec  
17:38 <@sdumitriu> It is Java 5, but for those born and raised before, it's not classic Java  
17:38 <vmassol> yeah and I'm glad java evolves

17:39 <cjdelisle> Annotations allow you to make a class which makes no sense unless you know how other code will handle those annotations.  
17:40 <vmassol> same with OO  
17:40 <vmassol> that's the point  
17:40 <vmassol> :)  
17:40 <vmassol> its called abstraction  
17:41 <vmassol> everytihng can be abused

17:42 <vmassol> :)

17:44 <cjdelisle> The problem with annotations is you look at the code and you see then annotation, you look at the annotation and and it's a dead end. It doesn't point to the code which uses it.

17:44 <vmassol> in order to be extra sure I'm not brealing anything  
17:44 <vmassol> breaking

17:45 <vmassol> same with interfaces caleb  
17:45 <vmassol> sorry misread  
17:45 <vmassol> I read implements  
17:46 <vmassol> usage is marked with the @myannotation  syntax  
17:46 <cjdelisle> Somewhere burried in the mass of code is something which also points to that annotation. The only way to find it is fins ./ -name '\*.java' -exec grep '@ThingThatDoesSomething' {} \; -print

17:47 <cjdelisle> Interfaces are fine on their own, when you bring dependency injection into the mix you get the same problems.

17:47 <cjdelisle> hehe, that's also a good sign that something is wrong with a language when you need a program to write it for you.

17:53 <cjdelisle> Same here but I think that annotations hurt maintainability/readability.

18:06 <cjdelisle>  ie to make it more complex (too clever?) to use than the initial  "problem"  
18:06 <cjdelisle> " "  
18:06 <cjdelisle> That's something I thought a lot about.  
18:06 <cjdelisle> TransactionRunnable is 491 lines and has lots of javadoc commentary.  
18:07 <cjdelisle> That's also something I accuse the java community process of having a hard time with. Everyone wants their use case explicitly satisfied and the code becomes too complex and large.  
18:08 <vmassol> depends, the latest releases of JEE specs are really good  
18:08 <vmassol> but yes consensus leads to that  
18:08 <vmassol> it's the same for xwiki  
18:08 <vmassol> but it has good sides too  
18:08 <vmassol> (xwiki is consensus based dev)  
18:09 <cjdelisle> Consensus is great for a project that is already moving.  
18:09 <vmassol> yep  
18:09 <jvelo> has quit  
18:09 <cjdelisle> But when all you have is an idea, IMO you need to write it and make it work before you let other people get involved.  
18:09 <@sdumitriu> All projects should start around a simple existing codebase  
18:10 <@sdumitriu> Trying to create a project from the design phase often leads to failure  
18:10 <cjdelisle> Otherwise everyone wants to take it a different direction and there is no visionary kernel for it to sit on.  
18:10 <@sdumitriu> Since everyone will want his ideas in in the first release  
18:10 <cjdelisle> ^yea that  
18:10 <vmassol> which isn't what the JCP does btw  
18:10 <vmassol> they always have a reference impl to prove it works  
18:11 <cjdelisle> That is good. Still it seems everything JCP is huge.  
18:11 <vmassol> + the people invovled have great exp in the domain having already written implementations  
18:11 <cjdelisle> hehe  
18:12 <vmassol> a vision is important indeed  
18:13 <cjdelisle> Another thing I think is important is that the developer needs to become the user and then the developer again. It is just too easy to write things which are unusable if you (I) don't use them first.  
18:13 <vmassol> yes hence TDD btw  
18:14 <cjdelisle> Tests are helpful but they usually aren't real workd use cases. I can say quite certainly that TransactionRunnable works quite well for saving attachments on the filesystem.  
18:15 <cjdelisle> That is to say it's easy to use the api.  
18:15 <vmassol> you can compare the # of lines to write to use it vs the try/catch idiom for ex  
18:16 <vmassol> (as an indicator)  
18:16 <cjdelisle> Also something I ask myself when writing is "can I test this without mocking?" If the answer is no then I consider the code not modular enough.  
18:16 <vmassol> yes that's good too in most cases  
18:16 <vmassol> at some point you need to mock though, for ex for accessing the real filesystem or the DB  
18:17 <cjdelisle> For filesystem tests I use the /tmp/ dir, for db, yes we will need a MockDBTransactionRunnable  
18:18 <vmassol> for filesystem it's bad to depend on the environment too  
18:18 <vmassol> it's unnecessary points of failures  
18:18 <vmassol> + won't work on some OS ;)

18:18 <vmassol> yes I know  
18:19 <vmassol> it can be full, it can be read only, etc  
18:19 <vmassol> it can be locked by another process  
18:19 <vmassol> lots of potential failures  
18:19 <vmassol> what I did in the past  
18:19 <vmassol> (and I loved that)  
18:19 <vmassol> was to use a virtual file system framework  
18:19 <vmassol> (it was apache vfs I used)

18:21 <vmassol> which is a pity  
18:21 <vmassol> http://commons.apache.org/vfs/  
18:21 <cjdelisle> not maintained. qmail isn't maintained but it's far from dead ;)  
18:22 <vmassol> not maintained == dead for me  
18:22 <vmassol> since no softwate is perfect

18:25 <@sdumitriu> myxwiki crashed again waiting for mysql data, while mysql considers all data sent  
18:32 <cjdelisle> Re changing the schema. I don't want to change the schema with the only engine supporting the old schema being the legacy engine in the core.  
18:33 <cjdelisle> We can break XHS.java up into TransactionRunnables and then we have a clean implementation of the old schema and whetever we don't like in the old schema we can pull out and replace one at a time.  
18:35 <cjdelisle> I don't like the idea of relying on XHS.java for migration.
